episodeTitle: Chopper's in Danger! Former God vs Priest Shura
description: Chopper desperately tries to protect the Going Merry from Priest Shura's fiery assault. When the situation becomes dire, Gan Fall arrives to confront Shura. Meanwhile, Nami, Zoro, and Robin navigate the dangerous Upper Yard forest, and Luffy faces Satori once again.

events.title: Gan Fall Reveals History of Skypiea Conflict
events.description: Gan Fall explains to Conis and Pagaya the endless conflict between the Sky People and Shandians, revealing it began when Upper Yard was born and a song incited violence. He shares that as Skypiea's former god, he sought peace and believes the same song will eventually bring it.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory about the Skypiea-Shandian conflict and establishes Gan Fall's philosophy of peace. Reveals that 'gods' in Skypiea are overthrowable rulers rather than divine beings.

quotes.text: The conflict between our people and the Shandians supposedly began when Upper Yard was born and a song incited violence.
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Explaining the origins of the Sky Island conflict

events.title: Pirates Visited Skypiea 20 Years Ago
events.description: Gan Fall mentions that pirates visited Skypiea twenty years ago and became his friends, hinting at a significant past connection between the surface world and Sky Islands.
events.significance: Foreshadows important connections to past events and possibly Noland's crew or other significant pirates.

events.title: Shura and Fuza Confront Chopper
events.description: Priest Shura arrives at the Going Merry on his giant bird Fuza to eliminate Chopper, who has been left alone to guard the ship. Shura declares that since some sacrifices escaped, Chopper must die in their place.
events.significance: First major appearance of Shura as an antagonist in this episode, establishing his role as one of Enel's priests and the threat to Chopper and the Going Merry.

quotes.text: Since some of the people brought for the sacrifice escaped, you have to die in their stead and your death will weigh on them in realizing their mistakes.
quotes.speaker: Shura
quotes.context: Threatening Chopper about the escaped Straw Hats

events.title: Shura Attacks Chopper and the Going Merry
events.description: Shura begins his assault on Chopper using his Heat Javelin and Fuza's fire breath, setting parts of the Going Merry ablaze. Chopper desperately tries to defend the ship but is overwhelmed by Shura's superior combat abilities.
events.significance: Showcases Chopper's determination to protect the ship and highlights the damage being inflicted on the Going Merry, which becomes a recurring concern throughout the series.

events.title: Chopper's Resolve to Protect the Going Merry
events.description: Despite being terrified and outmatched, Chopper refuses to abandon the Going Merry. He rips out the burning mast with his bare hands to prevent the fire from spreading, demonstrating his deep love for the ship and his crew.
events.significance: Character development moment showing Chopper's growth and dedication. Foreshadows the crew's deep emotional connection to the Going Merry that becomes central to later arcs.

events.title: Chopper Calls for Help
events.description: Realizing he cannot defeat Shura alone, Chopper uses the whistle given to him to summon Gan Fall, the Knight of the Sky. This marks a crucial moment where Chopper swallows his pride to protect his crewmates' ship.
events.significance: Shows Chopper's maturity in recognizing when he needs help, and sets up Gan Fall's heroic entrance.

events.title: Heat Javelin Demonstrated
events.description: Shura demonstrates the full power of his Heat Javelin, a lance containing a Heat Dial that can ignite anything it touches. He stabs Chopper with the burning weapon, inflicting serious injuries.
events.significance: Showcases Dial technology and Shura's combat capabilities. Establishes the Heat Javelin as a formidable weapon.

events.title: Gan Fall Arrives to Rescue Chopper
events.description: Just as Shura is about to deliver the killing blow to Chopper, Gan Fall arrives on Pierre in his full Knight of the Sky regalia. He immediately engages Shura in combat to protect Chopper and the Going Merry.
events.significance: Establishes Gan Fall as a protector and ally of the Straw Hats. Shows his commitment to helping those who call upon him.

events.title: Gan Fall vs Shura Battle Begins
events.description: Gan Fall and Shura engage in aerial combat, with both showing impressive combat skills. They appear evenly matched initially, with Gan Fall wielding his lance and Shura using his Heat Javelin and Fuza.
events.significance: Major battle showcasing two experienced Sky Island warriors. Demonstrates Gan Fall's combat prowess despite his age.

events.title: Ordeal of String Revealed
events.description: Shura activates his Ordeal of String, releasing nearly invisible String Clouds throughout the area. These thin, high-tensile-strength clouds slowly entangle opponents without them noticing until they can no longer move.
events.significance: Introduces a unique and dangerous ability that makes Shura's trial have a 3% survival rate. Showcases the creative use of Dial and Cloud technology in Skypiea.

events.title: Nami Attacked by Sky Sharks
events.description: While exploring Upper Yard's forest with Zoro and Robin, Nami is repeatedly attacked by sky sharks emerging from the clouds. Zoro and Robin continually rescue her from these aerial predators.
events.significance: Showcases the dangerous wildlife of Skypiea and provides comic relief. Demonstrates the teamwork between the Straw Hat members.

events.title: Luffy Regains Consciousness
events.description: Luffy wakes up after being knocked out by Satori in the previous encounter. Satori immediately prepares to launch another attack on the rubber captain.
events.significance: Sets up the continuation of Luffy's battle with Satori, one of Enel's priests.

quotes.text: Since some of the people brought for the sacrifice escaped, you have to die in their stead and your death will weigh on them in realizing their mistakes.
quotes.speaker: Shura
quotes.context: Threatening Chopper about being the remaining sacrifice

quotes.text: The conflict between our people and the Shandians supposedly began when Upper Yard was born and a song incited violence.
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Explaining the history of Skypiea to Conis and Pagaya

themes.description: Chopper demonstrates tremendous courage by standing his ground against a vastly superior opponent to protect the Going Merry, showing that bravery isn't about not being afraid, but doing what's right despite fear.
themes.symbolism: Chopper ripping out the burning mast symbolizes his willingness to endure pain to protect what he loves.

themes.description: Gan Fall's discussion about the endless war between Sky People and Shandians explores themes of inherited conflict and the difficulty of achieving lasting peace.
themes.symbolism: The mysterious song that both started the conflict and may end it represents the cyclical nature of violence and reconciliation.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the bonds between crew and ship, with Chopper willing to sacrifice himself to protect the Going Merry and, by extension, his crewmates' ability to continue their journey.
themes.symbolism: The Going Merry represents the crew's dreams and unity, making its protection a sacred duty.

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper shows significant character growth, displaying both his determination to protect his crew's ship and his wisdom in knowing when to call for help. His terror is genuine, but his resolve is stronger.
keyActions: Desperately defends the Going Merry from Shura's attacks
Rips out the burning mast to prevent fire from spreading
Gets stabbed by Shura's Heat Javelin but refuses to give up
Calls for Gan Fall's help using the whistle

characterSpotlights.development: Shura is established as a cruel but effective priest of Enel, showing both his combat prowess and his adherence to the sacrifice system. Shows moments of seeming pity toward Chopper while still being ruthless.
keyActions: Attacks Chopper and the Going Merry with Heat Javelin and fire
Demonstrates his Ordeal of String technique
Engages in aerial combat with Gan Fall
quotes: Since some of the people brought for the sacrifice escaped, you have to die in their stead and your death will weigh on them in realizing their mistakes.

characterSpotlights.development: Gan Fall serves dual roles in this episode: providing crucial backstory about Skypiea's conflict while also demonstrating his commitment to protecting those who call upon him, regardless of the danger.
keyActions: Explains Skypiea-Shandian conflict to Conis and Pagaya
Provides sanctuary for Pagaya and Conis
Arrives to rescue Chopper from Shura
quotes: The conflict between our people and the Shandians supposedly began when Upper Yard was born and a song incited violence.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several action sequences, particularly Chopper's struggle against Shura, to fill the episode runtime.

trivia.fact: This episode received a 10.0% TV rating in Japan and ranked 9th in viewership for its time slot.
Ikue Ōtani, Chopper's voice actress, is praised in reviews for conveying genuine terror during Chopper's ordeal with Shura.

sources.title: Never Watched One Piece - Episode 162 Review

trivia.fact: A continuity error occurs in this episode where Conis's eye color fluctuates during one scene.
The technique 'Satori: Bikkuri Tamakazura: Tama Dragon' makes its animated debut in this episode.
